| regnum = Animalia phylum = Chordata classis = Actinopterygii ordo =

| [[Astronotus]] species = 'A. ocellatus' binomial = Astronotus ocellatus
| binomial_authority = (Agassiz, 1831)
}} 'Astronotus ocellatus' is a species of fish from the cichlid family known
under a variety of common names, including 'oscar', 'tiger oscar', 'velvet
cichlid', or 'marble cichlid'. In South America,
where the species naturally resides, A. ocellatus specimens are often found for
sale as a food fish in the local markets. The
fish can also be found in other areas, including China, Australia, and the
United States. It is considered a popular aquarium fish in the U.S. Keith,
P. O-Y. Le Bail & P. Planquette, (2000) Atlas des poissons d'eau douce de Guyane
(tome 2, fascicule I). Publications scientifiques du MusÃ©um national d'Histoire
naturelle, Paris, France. p. 286
